annotation_sentence: Sure! I developed a mobile app for organizing study schedules. The biggest challenge was ensuring it was user-friendly. I tackled this by gathering feedback from peers and iterating based on their suggestions.
rationale: The word 'a' is a quantifier indicating a single instance of 'mobile app'. 'Biggest' is a superlative form of 'big', which is used to compare the size or extent of the challenge relative to others.

annotation_sentence: Mostly through direct interviews. I found it more effective to watch users interact with the app and note their reactions.
rationale: The word 'more' is a comparative quantifier used to indicate a greater degree of effectiveness.

annotation_sentence: I believe my greatest strength is my ability to communicate effectively. I make sure everyone is on the same page and encourage open dialogue.
rationale: The word 'greatest' is a superlative quantifier indicating the highest degree of strength. 'Same' is a quantifier indicating uniformity or lack of difference.
